title: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
description: When attempting to cancel the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the cancellation request is ignored and the progress dialog closes immediately. Additionally, even though the cancellation request is ignored, the exception list eventually comes up. The expected behavior is for the cancellation request to be honored, and either the process should be cancelled or the cancel button should be disabled.
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint and attempting to cancel the process, the cancellation request is ignored and the progress dialog closes immediately. The exception list still appears even though the cancellation was requested.
EB: When adding an exception breakpoint and attempting to cancel the process, the cancellation request should be honored. The progress dialog should either be cancelled or the cancel button should be disabled.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective. 2) Click the J! button to add an exception. 3) In the progress dialog, click cancel.
